docs.title: Clean
docs.text:
1. Connect both right and left doors to the slider
  2. Take off glasses: left & top
  3. Take off metal parts (3 components)
    • during installation, place the central one gently at last

docs.title: Sample preparation
docs.text:
• Sample vial: disposable 12 ml borosilicate glass vial (Labco 9RK8)
  • Sample size: 100–200 µg
  • ? Sequence (24 dummies + standards 16 + samples 50): 8 bypass (old Carrara Z), Carrara Z × 3, Fletton clay, 8 bypass (old samples/standards), 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Fletton clay, Carrara Z × 3, 8 acid dump

docs.title: Procedures
docs.text:
1. Check data (esp. last one) and acid usage
  2. Check acid pump (esp. Monday)
    1. Forward
    2. manually click button on acid pump multiple times: should be <4s per drop
    3. wipe off acid
    4. ?? change Acid Pump–Calibrate...
  3. Refill acid (stock is on SIRA)
  4. Put on dummies/standards/samples
  5. Needle maintenance
    • curve
    • hole is clear
    • use little drill to clean (~1 mm)
    • put tubes behind the arm of auto-sampler and connect the needles
  6. Aquisation: edit .seq file
    • Filename
    • use a different method with more acid drops for samples with less TIC
    • Option
  7. Check: Ref 1 On/Off
  8. Start
  9. Check first bypass: peaks should decrease

docs.title: Flush on GasBench (2)
docs.text:
1. Needle maintenance…
  2. Put back needle and press OK
  3. Sequence: GAS FLUSHFILL MISC SINGLE NEEDLE
  4. First one:
    1. Check out flow from the glass capillary
    2. Check on/off results of the working gas (routine for DIC analysis)

docs.title: Acid pump
docs.text:
https://www.fluidmetering.com/how-it-works

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EsaawMQ5JbY

https://www.youtube.com/@fmipump1959/videos

RH0CKC

  • Air in pump:
    1. disconnect the metal tube and manually click button on acid pump
    2. if too much air, do 1 and then pump DI water until it starts to spout, and then pump acid (discard acid after pumping)

docs.title: Log
docs.text: High Voltage 2.952 kV HV 3.02 kV Box 0.74 mA Trap 0.76 mA Vac (needle valve off) 4.9e-8 Vac (needle valve on) 8.9e-7 On/Off 44, 45, 46 3780, 4470, 5400

docs.title: Misc.
docs.text:
• Reboot auto-sampler:
    • disconnect power cord, reconnect
    • Check positions
      • remove needles
      • Menu > Utilities > F3 > Object Trays > Tray 01
  • Change fan
    • push and pull out/insert the cable
  • Nafion for water removal
  • Replace He (ca. 6 months)
    1. turn off source, needle valve
    2. old cylinder: turn off valve, disconnect, write MT
    3. new cylinder: connect (using a short spanner to prevent over-tightness), 3 bar (>1 bar for regulator in GasBench), leak check, write date
    4. wait 5 mins, turn on needle valve
    5. turn on source
  • Replace filament (#1027920)
    1. turn off: source, needle valve, pumps (on the panel, hear the turbo pump down)
    2. open door by removing 2 screws
    3. unplug 3 cables without damaging the PCB
    4. loose 4 screws
    5. remove 3 screws
    6. press source when loosening the 4th screw to prevent it popping out
    7. replace filament
      1. gloves on
      2. take off 4 screws
      3. half tighten 2 screws, push filament up left, fully tighten 2 screws
      4. insert two leads (+/−) into the slots
      5. press and check the metal connections
      6. check multimeter
    8. monitor high vacuum ( Instrument control)
      • 1e-6 → <1e-7
    9. turn on pumps (on the panel)
    10. turn on source (needle valve off): high vacuum increases, and then return back
    11. turn off source
    12. turn on needle valve high vacuum ≈1e-6
    13. note down previous sensitivity
    14. Auto focus
    15. save
    16. Pass to gasconfiguration
    17. run CO2 OnOff Sept2014.seq (100 measurements, save in ... CO2 ONOFF)
      • BGD44: 14 → 2.4 mV
      • sensitivity: 4500 → 4100
      • check linearity between different cycles within one measurement (1–10V, step?, ??<0.03‰/V)

docs.title: Sample preparation
docs.text:
• Sample size: µg
  • Sequence:

docs.title: Procedures
docs.text:
1. Open He cylinder
  2. Turn on carrier gas to 1.0 bar
  3. Leak check for both ends of the reactor
  4. Turn on green button behind EA
  5. Check the fan beside both ends of the reactor
  6. GC column: 90 °C, Reactor: 500 °C (JUMO temperature controller)
    1. press “P” twice to display SP
    2. set temperature
    3. press “P” twice to display current temperature

docs.title: Standby
docs.text:
1. Turn off needle valve (slowly, watch vacuum)
  2. Purge gas: 0
  3. Carrier gas: 0.5 bar (5 PSI)
  4. Reactor: 500 °C
  5. Turn off CO cylinder

docs.title: Refill and change reactor
docs.text: per 100 samples

docs.title: change
docs.text:
1. Turn off source
  2. Turn off needle valve, and Vac drop from 1e-6 to 1e-7?
  3. Reactor: 500 °C
  4. Carrier gas: 0.5 bar (5 PSI)
  5. …

docs.title: Deash
docs.text:
per 200 samples

  1. Turn off source
  2. Turn off needle valve, and Vac drop from 1e-6 to 1e-7
  3. Deash
  4. Turn on needle valve

docs.title: Determine dilution
docs.text:
Do this after changing filament

  1. Check previous sensitivity: ConFlo IV Interface Show Reference Gas Dilution
  2. Ref Dil 0, peak center, Auto focus for CO2
  3. Do the same for N2
  4. Determine Reference Gas Dilution, ~10 min (auto test combinations: shown in ConFlo IV Diagnosis)
  5. Run OnOff

Choose gas:

  1. Gas configuration
  2. Turn on

docs.title: Log
docs.text: High Voltage kV HV kV Box mA Trap mA Vac (needle valve off) ?e-8 Vac (needle valve on) 1.6e-6 On/Off 44, 45, 46 ,,

docs.title: General Guide
docs.text: • Be careful with high vacuum pump, source, reference gas

docs.title: Sample preparation
docs.text:
• Sample vial: disposable 0.75 ml borosilicate glass vial (Kimble 60831D-830) (put into reusable Kiel’s septum-free reusable borosilicate vial)
  • Sample size: 20–100 µg
  • Sequence
    • Line 1 & Line 2 (standards 12 + samples 30): Carrara Z × 3, Atlantis II, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Atlantis II, Carrara Z × 3
    • Line 1 only (standards 8 + samples 15): Carrara Z × 3, Atlantis II, 15 samples, Atlantis II, Carrara Z × 3

docs.title: Procedures
docs.text:
1. LN2
    1. Check LN2 tank
      • 15 samples: consumes 15%
    2. Moving
      • pressure inside vessel < 50% of the relief valve level
      • relief valve orientated away from face
    3. Change tank
      1. disconnect from empty tank: cable, small nut, big nut
      2. connect to full tank: Seal big nut with PTFE film, 3 times
      3. fully open valve, and then turn it back one full rotation
    4. Change blue LN2 bucket into an empty one
  2. Perform an acid drop test if the equipment has not been used for a long period
    • routinely do acid drop test per 2–3 days
  3. Grease vials, insert disposable vials into Kiel’s vial
  4. Clear acid pump
    1. Acquisition – Kiel IV Carbonate: right Take magazine, until Ready...
    2. wipe off acid
    3. stick paper into the circular space around the needles to clean
    4. take off O-ring, clean, check, (replace), grease (per week, Monday, leaking rate <1200)
    5. check alignment of needle and sensor
    6. load empty/standards/samples
      • pos 1 for line 1, 2: empty vial
      • pos 2 for line 2: empty vial when using line 1 only sequence
    7. Kiel IV Carbonate: right Load magazine
  5. Check JUMO temperature controller
  6. Fill LN2
  7. Edit sequence in Acquisition (CO2_KielIV_Godwin_*.seq)
    1. input Identifier 1, Weight [mg] for standards
    2. Options: update date in the folder’s name
    3. Save
    4. optional: select part of the sequence
    5. Start
  8. Method (CO2_KielIV_Godwin.met)
    • Refill Time: increase, when? how much?

docs.title: Misc.
docs.text:
• Idle: fill pos 1, 2 of line 1, 2 with empty vials
  • Reboot computer:
    • icon on the taskbar: Shutdown (may be grey)
    • reboot computer
    • Kiel IV Carbonate: Turn on “Oven control” & check JUMO temperature controller light on the Front Panel
  • Check ref gas refill
    1. set bellow to 100
    2. pump away
    3. 10s …

docs.title: Sample preparation
docs.text:
• Sample vial: reusable 1 ml borosilicate glass vial (WHEATON W986284NG) + black cap + blue septa (Analytical Columns C234115)
  • Sample size: 100–150 µg
  • Sequence (standards 12 + samples 30): Carrara Z × 3, Atlantis II, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Atlantis II, Carrara Z × 3
graph TD
1((01)) --> 5((05))
6((06)) --> 10((10))
11((11)) --> 15((15))
16((16)) --> 20((20))
21((21)) --> 25((25))
26((26)) --> 30((30))
31((31)) --> 35((35))
36((36)) --> 40((40))
41((41)) --> 42((42))

docs.title: Procedures
docs.text:
1. Flush sample needle with He gas
    1. Prep–Move Gilson to next vial. If Gilson does not move: Prep–Initialise Gilson, then try again.
    2. AB, MH
    3. Check: AD
    4. AE
    5. Connect He gas, open cylinder valve, open regulator valve
    6. Wipe off acid
    7. Check flow rate through the needle
    8. Disonnect He gas
  2. Pump out
    1. Put on an old vial on needle: holes inside the vial & DO NOT touch the acid
    2. ML, AD, until ML vac ≈ 1.0e-3
    3. Prep–Initialise Gilson
  3. Remove old vial
  4. AB, ML
  5. MH (auto ML)
  6. Change old sample vials in the heater block into new sample vials
  7. Replenish reference gas
    1. LV, RP, RV
    2. Set bellow to 1400
    3. Inlet–Toggle C/O valve, until 44 < 4e-11
    4. RM
    5. Check SP
    6. RI
    7. Manually operate 2 toggle valves (upper, lower) on reference gas cylinder
      1. L: pump out reference gas between the two valves 30s
      2. L, U: release reference gas 30s
      3. LV
      4. U, L: replenish reference gas 30s
      5. L
    8. RI, RP
    9. Set bellow to 0, until bellow fully open
    10. RM
    11. Check 44 ≈ 2.5e-9
  8. Test–Peak center
  9. Close scan
  10. Update sample table in batch MPRPCM
    1. Analysis–Autorun batch edit–select MPRPCM from the list
    2. MPRPCM: Setup
    3. Release all
    4. Enter new sample numbers, then OK–OK
  11. Fill LN2 dewar (20L, record on the notebook)
  12. Check two tubes: ~2 cm from the end of the wood stick, then put them into the LN2 dewar
  13. Check connecting pipe
  14. Check paper
  15. Press LF/FF button twice? to feed paper forward until 3 holes are out
  16. Analysis–Autorun start/stop–select MPRPCM from the list, Run

docs.title: Sample preparation
docs.text:
1. Check liquid quantity 1.5 ml
  2. Loosen lids
  3. Fill standards (no bubbles!), mark them

docs.title: Procedures
docs.text:
1. Check N2 cylinder ( bar)

  2. Autosampler

    1. Change septa
    2. Chg syringe
      1. solvent
      2. rinse
      3. Swap done

  3. Monitor

    • H2O ppm
    • Outlet valve

docs.title: Sample preparation
docs.text:
• Sample vial: reusable 1 ml borosilicate glass vial (WHEATON W986284NG) + black cap + blue septa (Analytical Columns C234115)
  • Sample size: 100–150 µg
  • Sequence (standards 12 + samples 30): Carrara Z × 3, Atlantis II, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Atlantis II, Carrara Z × 3
graph TD
1((01)) --> 5((05))
6((06)) --> 10((10))
11((11)) --> 15((15))
16((16)) --> 20((20))
21((21)) --> 25((25))
26((26)) --> 30((30))
31((31)) --> 35((35))
36((36)) --> 40((40))
41((41)) --> 42((42))

docs.title: Monday
docs.text:
1. Prep-Water trap chiller on
  2. AC, ML, MH
  3. If no error, AB
  4. Test acid drop
    1. Put tissue under needle
    2. Prep-Dispense acid
    3. Check acid drop after ~5 mins. If not, repeat the last step.
    4. Redo 2 & 3
  5. 45–60 mins

docs.title: Monday to Thursday
docs.text:
1. Check status: Finished Autorun
  2. Remove LN2 tubes from dewar
  3. Put lids on samples
  4. Flush sample needle with He gas
    1. Prep–Move Gilson to next vial. If Gilson does not move: Prep–Initialise Gilson, then try again.
    2. AB, MH
    3. Check: AD
    4. AE
    5. Connect He gas, open cylinder valve, open regulator valve
    6. Wipe off acid
    7. Check flow rate through the needle
    8. Disonnect He gas
  5. Pump out
    1. Put on an old vial on needle: holes inside the vial & DO NOT touch the acid
    2. ML, AD, until ML vac ≈ 1.0e-3 (take out old sample vials in the heater block)
    3. Prep–Initialise Gilson
  6. Remove old vial
  7. AB, ML
  8. MH (auto ML)
  9. Refill reference gas
    1. Set reference gas bellow to 3100 (Stage 2)
    2. LV, RP, RV, until LV vac ≈ 1.0e-3 (Put new sample vials into the heater block)
    3. Inlet–Toggle C/O valve, until 44 < 4e-11
    4. RM
    5. Check SP
    6. RI
    7. Manually operate 2 toggle valves (upper, lower) on reference gas cylinder
      1. L: pump out reference gas between the two valves 30s
      2. L, U: release reference gas into the space between L and U 30s
      3. LV
      4. RP (Stage 2)
      5. U, L: refill reference gas 30s (edit batch MPRPCM)
      6. L
    8. Measure reference gas
      1. RI, RP
      2. Set reference gas bellow to 0, until bellow fully open
      3. RM
      4. Check 44 ≈ 2.5e-9
  10. Test–Peak center
  11. Close scan
  12. Update sample table in batch MPRPCM
    1. Analysis–Autorun batch edit–select MPRPCM from the list
    2. MPRPCM: Setup
    3. Release all
    4. Enter new sample numbers, then OK–OK
  13. Reboot by Ctrl+Alt+Del
  14. Fill LN2 dewar
    • wear PPE
    • efficient transfer is achieved at 5–10 psi
    • filled to 90% of their net capacity to reduce the risk of spillage
    • 20L, record on the notebook
  15. Check two tubes: ~2 cm from the end of the wood stick, then put them into the LN2 dewar
  16. Check connecting pipe
  17. Check paper
  18. Press LF/FF button twice? to feed paper forward until 3 holes are out
  19. Analysis–Autorun start/stop–select MPRPCM from the list, Run

docs.title: Friday Standby
docs.text:
1. Check status: Finished Autorun
  2. Remove LN2 tubes from dewar
  3. Prep–Water trap chiller off
  4. ML, AB (check: AC)
  5. LV, RP, RF, RV, until LV vac ≈ 1.0e-3
  6. HV

docs.title: CO<sub>2</sub> from organic matter
docs.text:
1. HV
  2. RP, RF, check RI
  3. Disconnect Carrara Z reference gas cylinder
  4. Connect organic reference gas cylinder
  5. Fill organic reference gas
    1. Set reference gas bellow to 1000
    2. ? LV, RP, RF, RV, RM, until LV vac ≈ 1.0e-3
    3. Inlet–Toggle C/O valve, until 44 < 4e-11
    4. RM
    5. ? Check SP
    6. RI
    7. Manually operate 2 toggle valves (upper, lower) on organic reference gas cylinder
      1. L: pump out reference gas between the two valves 30s
      2. L, U: release reference gas into the space between L and U 30s
      3. LV
      4. RP
      5. U, L: refill reference gas 30s
      6. L
    8. Measure organic reference gas
      1. RI, RP, RF
      2. RM
      3. Tune reference gas bellow (squeeze, larger value) ⟹ 44 ≈ 6e-9
      4. ? RV
      5. ? disable changeover
      6. Manually analyse against reference gas itself (DACP–CO2, Sample name: ORG GAS REF). Disconnect organic reference gas cylinder
  6. ? Enable changeover
  7. (Check RI) Cut glass sample tube, insert into metal tube (from the simple end), connect (the more complicated end with a filter) to reference gas inlet
  8. Fill sample gas
    1. Set sample gas bellow to 0
    2. ? LV, RI, RP, SP, until LV vac ≈ 1.0e-3
    3. SF, SV, SM, until LV vac ≈ 1.0e-3
    4. Inlet–Toggle C/O valve, until 44 < 4e-11
    5. LV
    6. Break sample tube, until 44 is stable
  9. Measure sample gas
    1. RI, SF (store sample gas in between)
    2. Tune sample gas bellow (squeeze, larger value) ⟹ 44 ≈ 6e-9, record the value
    3. Inlet–Toggle C/O valve, tune reference gas bellow (squeeze, larger value) ⟹ sample − reference ≈ 0.08
    4. Inlet–Toggle C/O valve, tune sample gas bellow (squeeze, larger value) ⟹ sample − reference ≈ 0.08
    5. RV, SV
    6. Manually analyse (DACP–CO2, Sample name: …). Disconnect sample gas tube
  10. Repeat 6–8. Can pump sample gas in between RI and SF (LV) when the analysis for current sample gas appears to be OK
  11. (Check RI) Connect Carrara Z reference gas cylinder
  12. Standby
    1. Changeover → waste
    2. ? Set both bellows to 0
    3. Pump all that is left of SI: LV, open RI…, until LV vac ≈ 1.0e-3
    4. RI
    5. HV

docs.title: Misc.
docs.text:
• Cold fingers: click stop before clicking heat/cool
  • Scan config for OCR : 600 dpi, Gray scale, TIFF
  • Replenish reference gas:
    • Stage 1: RP, gradually decrease reference gas bellow (increase bellow size) through time
      • until 2024-01-23: 1400
    • Stage 2: RP, gradually decrease reference gas bellow (increase bellow size) through time
      • after 2024-01-23: 3100

docs.title: Data quality control
docs.text:
• Ion Gauge for Sample and Reference are similar, difference < 0.2e-8
  • Error 1051 is OK

docs.title: Version history
docs.text:
• 2024-01-11: Compiled by Xi (Sean) Chen, based on notes and tuition from James Rolfe
  • 2024-02-17: Add CO2 from organic matter
